This is the most popular method used in SA both by patients and health care providers.
• It is safe and effective however has less continuation rates compared with LARCS hence the increased risk of
poorly spaced or unintended pregnancy.
• It can be administered immediately postpartum both in breastfeeding and non-breastfeeding mums. It does not
have any drug interactions.
• The patient must be given a family planning card with the date for her next injection.
